Why did you add this ?

 rejectEverythingUserSpecific of type MatchesRegExp=
DecideRule
 decision: REJECT
  regexp: http://www\.citeulike\.org/user/.*/.=
*

 rejectGroups of type MatchesRegExpDecideRule
  decision: REJECT
  regex=
p: http://www\.citeulike\.org/groups/.*

Won't that reject the tags that we=
 may need to tell the crawler ? won't they take us to next pages ? I mean l=
ink us to other pages ?

When I removed this rule it stopped 
SurtPrefixedD=
ecideRule

 
Thanks !

in <skhenkin@...> wrote:

't make me blush :)

rix.

> > In any of the rules , when we say ACCEPT , does that say anythi=
ng to 
> > REJECT other things ? or maybe prefer these links on other links=
 ?
> 
> No, ACCEPT can only either accept URI for fetching/saving/etc or pa=
ss to 
> the next rule in the chain. The rule that goes later overrides the=
 
> previous one.
>

s/sec seems to get 
> > little slower , since it seems that it tooks more t=
ime to compare all 
> > the regexp.
> >

 rules can increase the speed ?

hink that URI processing with

paring to page downloading and 
> delaying between the requests.
